name: Carlton Inn Midway

reviews.text: Staye don business, and while an older hotel, definitely full of charm. I liked that it was slightly different and unique than a regular box hotel. The bathroom was stunning with hex tile covering almost every surface, exposed chrome bath fixtures and neat claw foot tub. I worked with an architectural firm and from a design standpoint, it was a good unique place full of character to stay.
reviews.title: Charming to say the least

reviews.text: I am an over the road trucker in my truck broke down in Chicago today when I arrive at the Hotel the staff was very helpful the room was a lot better than I expected the stuff help me pull my stuff into the room they gave me a ride from the garage to the hotel then back to the garage the next day if I break down in Chicago again I am definitely staying here again
reviews.title: Been here before

reviews.text: One of my all time favorites and a genuine sleeper of a deal. Spotless and spacious rooms. Superb and hospitable service. All the staff fromYolanda and Valerie and YYvonne at the front desk to John and my favorite shuttle driverSteve made the stay the best part of the trip. An absolute bargain. Close to orange line. Great free breakfast with Dunkin Donut sandwiches and donuts. Can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Courtesy; Clean; Great Value.

reviews.text: I booked this hotel in the random price lottery through Priceline, as my flight was unexpectedly delayed and I needed inexpensive accommodations quickly. Since I had never heard of Carlton Inn, I assumed it was a locally-owned hotel (which concerned me, having seen Priceline's evaluation of hotels).
reviews.title: Diamond in the Rough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I called the hotel and the clerk immediately dispatched a shuttle to pick me up. Jon, the driver, was pleasant and helpful with tips about the area. I arrived at the hotel and horror flashed before me ... the area looked dangerous and the buildings appeared old and rundown. I immediately wanted to protest and have Priceline refund my monies. But, I was stranded due to lack of transportation so I decided to make the most of it.
reviews.title: Loved Everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted a weekend getaway in Chicago without overspending on the hotel. We chose this hotel which was under $200 for two nights. It was St. Patricks Day weekend. When we arrived at the hotel , the staff was very friendly. We did not understand how the "L" system worked and they provided us with a map and explained it all. They also provided us with the different fesitivies that was going on in the city. The hotel is located within 1 mile of the "L" which is about a 20 minute ride to downtown. The hotel provided us with a free shuttle to/from "L" station. I was skeptical of the cleaniness because of the price, but was pleasantly surprised. The room was quaint and clean. We had a wondeful stay and I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Inexpensive and clean

reviews.text: Arrived very early to Midway (9:30am) and they picked us up, agreed to store our luggage til our room was ready, and gave us a room to use to change so we could head downtown, then gave us a ride to the "L". They could not have been more pleasant! Will definitely stay there again!!
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know exactly how to start but first of all I want to thank everyone at Carlton Inn for making our stay so special and all the help they gave me with my plans to propose to my girlfriend. Everything was simply wonderful.
reviews.title: Carlton Inn - Home away from home

reviews.text: First of all, the shuttle came very fast at the airport to take us, the driver was very nice to take our luggage in the room and Talia upgraded our room from the full size bed to a queen size bed (which i can honestly say looked like a king) and this was very nice.Secondly Valerie gave us maps with the city, places where we can eat, she told us everything that we needed to know or asked.
reviews.title: Staff could not be more accommodating!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we got in the room we could not believe how nice and big it was. It had a table where we could stay and eat or stay at the laptop, a closet where we could hang some clothes and put our luggage, coffee, big television. For us to be more pleased everything was spotless, the bathroom very comfy, with a nice shower, shampoo and shower gel, and everything was smelling very clean,let's say.
reviews.title: Carlton Inn-Just Great!

reviews.text: We were with a group of eight and ended up having flight problems. Big storm in Chicago delayed our landing and then we missed our connecting flight. All other flights out were booked, so ended up staying night in Chicago before heading to final destination. We booked online thru Expedia about an hour before we showed up to claim our rooms. We booked three. When we arrived only one of the three reservations arrived, but luckily they had two extra rooms they booked for us. Rooms were clean and bed was comfortable. Room was quite and did not hear neighbors. Didn't look like the greatest neighborhood, but free shuttle to/from airport meant no taxi or subway rides needed. Didn't see any stores or restaurants nearby. Breakfast wasn't supposed to be served until 6 am, however we were catching the shuttle and 4:30 and breakfast was already out. So we did get breakfast, which included bagels, fruit, and juice. I'm sure there was more, but I didn't look closely. The clerk at desk was friendly and accommodating. Cost was average, about $150 a night. The hotel charge me for the rooms, along with Expedia charging me the room, so expecting a credit back on the dual scheduling.
reviews.title: Fine for Last Minute Option
Nice motel,friendly staff, close to downtown
reviews.text: We were visiting family and booked this motel because of its proximity to family and downtown,and free parking. We were able to check in early in the day which was nice and the front desk clerk was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean for the most part,there was a dirty towel left behind the bathroom door and the carpet needs a good shampooing. The microwave and refrigerator were a nice plus. We found the room very quiet at night as well and rarely heard any planes. The drive to downtown took about 15 minutes and using the app Spothero helped us find cheap parking for the days we wondered around downtown. Overall the room served the purpose as it was really only used to sleep.

I'm not sure what is going on with this property. One of the negative reviews I saw before my trip has disappeared. It was from a gentleman who had just arrived in his room and could tell things weren't right. I figured his negative review was just a fluke. Big mistake! We arrived after midnight and it was too late to try to find anything else. First, the room was clean and the staff was friendly, but that should be expected anywhere. I did enjoy the shower. My teenage daughter was nervous because of the neighborhood the hotel is in. The beds were small and I have never slept on a more uncomfortable mattress. My mattress at home is pillow top, but nothing too fancy - not Sleep Number, Tempur-Pedic, or anything like that. I could feel the springs poking into me on the mattress at Carlton Inn. About the time I was able to finally get past my discomfort and get to sleep, the ridiculously loud heating/cooling unit would start up. It woke my husband and I up several times in the night. With the shape of the property, the parking was in the middle of all of the rooms, and every time someone else would arrive or depart, the noise would wake me up. I woke up early the next morning and called the hotel office immediately. I was informed that all of the hotel's beds are the same. I got on the phone with Orbitz and made arrangements to check out and get as much of my money back as possible. We stopped by the Carlton's continental breakfast buffet before we left. The donuts were stale and the breakfast sandwich was still frozen. We moved to the Holiday Inn and Suites by O'hare. We got a two-room suite with 2 queen beds for $89 per night. Our rate at Carlton was $137. The Holiday Inn beds were plush and comfy and the bedding was good quality. I'll be looking for Holiday Inn and Suites from now on wherever I go!
reviews.title: Lumpy, springy, uncomfortable beds!

reviews.text: We went for a weekend trip, Baseball, Museums ect.
reviews.title: Grate Staff and very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So it was at a good location to catch the L to get around.
reviews.title: "What a life saver"

reviews.text: We came to Chicago for a family funeral, and needed to pick up a daughter @ Midway Airport, so selected this hotel, based on a great rate. We were welcomed professionally, and offered all forms of assistance - plances to eat, transportation, baggage assistance. We followed their dinner suggestion and had a memorably wonderful meal. The next morning they offered, and we accepted, transport to the airport to pick up the daughter. They knew their way around, so this went beautifully. WE will definitely stay here again, and recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: wonderful experience!

reviews.text: Best stay and reasonably priced. Rooms are clean and quiet. Continental breakfast provided a variety of choices, plus coffee makers are in the rooms. Hotel is conveniently located just a block from CTA (the El) and only 4 or 5 stops from the loop making travel to and from the city easy. Even though its only a short walk, the hotel will shuttle you to and from the El if you prefer not to walk. The staff provided outstanding service and was very helpful. We asked for information on museums and were given a list of attractions that contained times and step by step directions to get to them. At one point we ventured off on our own and got lost - a call to the hotel and the staff put us back on the right track. Don't be fooled when you drive up, it looks like a Motel but the service will be like staying at a 4 Seasons. This will be one of the best stays you will have in Chicago.
reviews.title: Very Pleased - Glad we selected Carlton Inn Midway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I were in Chicago for the weekend, Apr 13, 2013 to do a bit of shopping and site seeing so we did our looking around and found this hotel. I am glad we did as our experience was certainly a good one. When we arrived we were greeted by a very friendly counter person who was very informative and extremely helpful. She pointed out all the amenities and services this place had to offer, which were many.
reviews.title: The people make the difference

reviews.text: After checking in, we entered the room and found it to smell clean and fresh, two traits we enjoy finding. Considering the location and the price we were very pleasantly pleased as they had a microwave, a fridge and all the things we would look for in an extended stay location. To bad we were only staying one night as this room was defiantly a nice one. We often travel and have stayed in a wide variety of places, ranking this one pretty high up on our list. The thing that defiantly makes the difference for us though is the people. Straight through the check in to the cleaning staff, it honestly goes to show that these people have pride in this place. Certainly something that was extremely nice to see.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was defiantly well positioned to get on the subway to head down town, only few blocks down the street, and considering the free parking, it defiantly saved us a bundle staying here for the night. The subway got us down town in only 15 minutes, which is pretty good, the only thing that sucked was how cold it was along with the wait for the train, I am guessing we just missed one. Beyond that it was pretty convenient having it so close to the hotel which provided easy access to any point within the city. My only concern was that if we came back late at night, the area around the subway exit was a little scary looking, especially for someone not used to that sort of site. Thankfully we didn't have that problem and I am sure if we requested the shuttle it would have come pick us up.
reviews.title: Good price-conscious choice at Midway

description: The Carlton Inn Midway offers the amenities and services of home or office. We are located 1.8 miles from Midway Airport with complimentary 24-hour transportation to and from. Whether you are in Chicago for a convention at McCormick Place or Shopping the Magnificent Mile we are 7 miles from the downtown area, with easy driving access via I-55 and around the corner from the Orange Line Elevated Train, a 15 minute train ride to downtown.
